title: IMF Cuts Global Growth Forecast Amid Supply Chain Disruptions, Warns of Inflation Risks
sub_head: Group also raises its inflation outlook, urging policy makers to stand ready to take swift action
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The International Monetary Fund lowered its growth forecast for the world economy for this year, citing supply-chain disruptions in rich economies and global-health concerns caused by the spread of the contagious Covid-19 Delta variant.
The group also raised its inflation outlook, urging policy makers to stand ready to take swift action if the recovery strengthens more quickly than expected or inflation risks become pronounced. Prices from food to medicine to vehicles have risen world-wide, threatening the global recovery after the pandemic wiped out businesses and jobs.
